Hi {!Lead.FirstName}
Inflation rate for 4.9% last month - so says the Government of India. Is that good news? Will products and services become cheaper? Will interest rates drop? Will loan EMIs come down? What all does that mean?
We don't know yet whether loan rates may drop and whether your EMIs will actually come down. But what we know is that there is a buzz around the growth story.
Last month we spoke about buying property and why it might make sense. This month we have an expert report reproduced here about house property demand - supply and prices.
Even if property purchase gets interesting and loans get cheaper - will you actually get that loan? Check out the article on CIBIL scores and how they may impact your ability to achieve your goals. And don't miss the market commentary and our other regular stories.
Summer is peaking, stay hydrated and take care. We'll catch up soon.
Regards
Bhuvana Shreeram
Head - Member Success Team
MARKET COMMENTARY
The month of April went quite well for the markets and the nifty gained close to 4.36%. Markets were expecting some positive news from the RBI and hence it rallied from the lows of 5477 to close the month at 5930. The RBI obliged the markets and cut the rate by 25 basis points. The Repo rate now stands at 7.25%. On the international front the Dow Jones rallied to its all-time highs and continued to remain strong throughout the month. Dow Jones has generally been a leading indicator as far as stocks are concerned. Hence we can expect our indices to continue its positive performance for few more months. Coming back to India the common man did not gain much from the RBI’s move as the bankers are not ready to pass on the benefits of the rate cut to the consumers. MY FINANCIAL PLANNER
Do you know you will get a loan? "For every disciplined effort, there is a multiple reward," said American motivational speaker and author Jim Rohn. This is true in every aspect of life, more so when it comes to fulfilling our life’s goals and dreams. It takes more than just a set of guidelines to get you there, but following it perfectly can ensure its success. The single most important step to make your financial plan successful is being disciplined in your approach – and the onus for this lies completely with you. Unfortunately, this is also the single most common mistake that people generally make. Disciplined investing allows one to take advantage of long term regular investment, over a period of time, resulting in a sustainable increase in asset values. HOUSEVIEW
Mumbai’s residential realty bubble may burst anytime now It has been about 2-3 years now since the sudden surge in new apartment prices across Mumbai and its peripheral areas. What makes this surge in prices unique is that unlike the previous years (2003-08) the rise in property prices has not been accompanied by a rise in GDP and income growth. In this article, I point-out several indicators that make a strong case for a sharp correction in residential realty prices in Mumbai any time over the next 6-18 months. The disconnect between apartment prices and income levels could well be at an all-time high in Mumbai at present. A comparison of apartment prices and income levels in Mumbai and New York, both economic power-houses of their respective countries, provides some food for thought.
